C.  Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program

The facility has a PSM/RMP Program that complies with both OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program and also serves as the Accidental Release Prevention Program.  The PSM/RMP Program consists of the following elements:
Management Systems
Employee Participation Program
Process Safety Information
Process Hazard Analysis
Operating Procedures
Training Program
Contractor Safety Program
Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures
Mechanical Integrity Program
Hot Work Permit Procedures
Management of Change Procedures
Incident Investigation Procedures
Compliance Audit Procedures
Emergency Action Procedures
Hazard Assessment
5 Year Accident History


D.  Five-Year Accident History

There have not been any ammonia-related accidents at the facility over the past five years that resulted in offsite consequences as outlined in the Accident History Section of the RMP Submittal.


E.  Description of the Emergency Response Program

An Emergency Action Plan (EAP) has been implemented at the facility.  The EAP contains procedures describing how the facility will react to ammonia spills or releases and other potential emergencies, including both shelter-in-place and evacuation procedures.  The program has been coordinated with local response agencies.  While the plant participates in technician-level ER training and drills, they do not have an emergency response team.  They do have the equipment to perform entry WITH the local HazMat Team, once they have taken over Incident Command.  Personnel trained on incident command are done so merely to facilitate coordination with local first responders.

Executive Summary

The Perry's Ice Cream plant uses Anhydrous Ammonia (NH3) as a heat transfer fluid in the plant refrigeration system.  The system is a two stage mechanical refrigeration system which achieves just under 1,900 Tons of Refrigeration (TR) compression.  The closed loop uses both liquid pumped over feed and flooded systems.  The system operates at a Low Stage Saturated Suction Pressure of 14 Hg.  The Intermediate Stage Saturated Suction pressure is 17 psig.  The Saturated Discharge Pressure is 120 psig.  The system is controlled by a Programmable Logic Controller and notification alarms via cell phone are distributed to all appropriate Team Members to address any adverse situation.  The plant is occupied by qualified technicians every day of the year except New Year's Day, Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day, as the refrigeration system must operate to protect the quality of the frozen products.  The plant has systems that are monitored by an off - site monitoring company, which is on duty 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

A.  Description of the Accident Release Prevention Program and Emergency Policies

PIC takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions such as pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  PIC has also implemented a preventive maintenance program which is designed to maintain the ongoing integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified associates, and emergency procedures designed to enable trained associates to respond quickly to system upsets.  The PSM/RMP Coordinator is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs.
